contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "throwing a net into the water to catch fish" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: casting a net in the sea

contextId.information: It can be assumed that this boat belongs to James and John. AT: "in their boat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It may be helpful to state clearly why Jesus called to James and John. AT: "called them to come with him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It is implied that food was served. AT: "she provided them with food and drinks" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Jesus told the man to show himself to the priest so that the priest could look at his skin to see if his leprosy was really gone. It was required in the law of Moses for a man to present himself to the priest if he had been cleansed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

It is implied that the large crowds prevented Jesus from being able to enter the towns because the crowds made it difficult for him to walk around there. AT: "the crowds prevented Jesus from moving freely in towns" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Jesus could no longer freely enter into any town

contextId.information: This refers to there being no space inside the house. AT: "there was no more room for them inside" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"Seeing the men's faith." Possible meanings are 1) that only the men who carried the paralyzed man had faith or 2) that the paralyzed man and the men who brought him to Jesus all had faith. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The disciples picked the heads of grain to eat them. This can be worded to show the full meaning. AT: "pick and eat heads of grain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Jesus refers to reading about David in the Old Testament. This can be translated showing the implicit information. AT: "read in the scriptures what David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The Pharisees wanted to accuse Jesus of breaking the law by the working on the Sabbath, should he heal the man. AT: "accuse him of wrongdoing" or "accuse him of breaking the law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

As the large crowd was pushing forward toward Jesus, he was in danger of being crushed. In the UDB, verses 9-10 are bridged and state this implicit information clearly. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_versebridge]])
contextId.quote: He asked his disciples to have a small boat ... not crush him

contextId.information: Here "they" refers to the unclean spirits. It is they who are causing the people they possess to do things. This can be made explicit. AT: "they caused the people they were possessing to fall down before him and to cry out to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: they fell down ... cried out, and they said

contextId.information: It may be helpful to explain why tribulation comes. It came because people believed the word.  AT: "because they believed the word" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The man was so strong that no one could subdue him. AT: "He was so strong that no one was strong enough to subdue him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: No one had the strength to subdue him

contextId.information: When the man first saw Jesus, Jesus would have been getting out of the boat. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: When he saw Jesus from a distance

contextId.information: What Jesus did not allow the man to do can be stated clearly. AT: "But he did not allow the man to come with them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: But Jesus did not permit him

contextId.information: "So Jesus went with Jairus." Jesus' disciples also went with him. AT: "So Jesus and the disciples went with Jairus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
She had heard reports about Jesus of how he healed people. AT: "that Jesus healed people" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"to come with him." It may be helpful to state where they were going. AT: "to accompany him to Jairus' house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It may be helpful to state where the child is. AT: "went into the room where the child was lying" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: went in where the child was

contextId.information: Some people were saying that Jesus was John the Baptist. This can be stated more clearly. AT: "Some were saying, 'He is John the Baptist who had been" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Some were saying, "John the Baptist had been

contextId.information: It may be helpful to state why some people thought he was Elijah. AT: "Some others said, 'He is Elijah, whom God promised to send back again.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The content of the oath, and the relationship between the oath and the dinner guests can be stated clearly. AT: "because his dinner guests had heard him make the oath that he would give her anything she asked for" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: because of the oath he had made and because of his dinner guests

contextId.information: The number of women and children was not counted. If it would not be understood that women and children were present, it can be made explicit. AT: "And there were five thousand men who ate the loaves. They did not even count the women and children" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: There were five thousand men who ate the loaves

contextId.information: If you need to be more specific, it can stated what they were amazed by. AT: "They were completely amazed at what he had done" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

It may be helpful to state why they ran through the region. AT: "they ran throughout the whole district in order to tell others that Jesus was there" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: they ran throughout the whole region

contextId.information: By doing this, the Pharisees are allowing people to not provide for their parents, if they promise to give to God what they would have given to them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: then you no longer permit him to do anything for his father or his mother

contextId.information: Jesus is speaking about what a person eats. This is in contrast to "what come out of the person." AT: "nothing from outside a person that he can eat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: nothing from outside of a person

contextId.information: It may be helpful to explain clearly what this phrase means. AT: "all foods clean, meaning that people can eat any food without God considering the eater defiled" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It may be helpful to clarify how they got to Dalmanutha. AT: "they sailed around the Sea of Galilee to the region of Dalmanutha" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: they went into the region of Dalmanutha

contextId.information: The Pharisees tried to test Jesus to make him prove that he was from God. Some information can be made explicit. AT: "to prove that God had sent him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

When Jesus speaks of "this generation," he is referring to the people who lived at that time. There Pharisees are included in this group. AT: "you and the people of this generation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Jesus disciples went with him. Some information can be made explicit. AT: "he left them, got into a boat again with his disciples" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he left them, got into a boat again

contextId.information: In this statement, it may be helpful to state that "it" refers to what Jesus had said. AT: "He must have said that because we have no bread" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: It is because we have no bread

contextId.information: It may be helpful to state when they collected the baskets of pieces. AT: "how many baskets full of broken pieces of bread did you collect after everyone finished eating" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: how many baskets full of broken pieces of bread did you take up

contextId.information: This is the disciples' answer, which some people said Jesus was. This can be shown more clearly. AT: "Some people say that you are John the Baptist" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Jesus did not want them to tell anyone that he was the Christ. This can be made more explicit. Also, this can also be written as a direct quote. AT: "Jesus warned them not to tell anyone that he is the Christ" or "Jesus warned them, 'Do not tell anyone that I am the Christ'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: Jesus warned them not to tell anyone about him

contextId.information: Peter rebuked Jesus for saying the things he said would happen to the Son of Man. This can be made explicit. AT: "began to rebuke him for saying these things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"because of me and because of the gospel." Jesus is talking about people who lose their lives because they follow Jesus and the gospel. This can be stated clearly. AT: "because he follows me and tells others the gospel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: for my sake and for the gospel

contextId.information: It may be helpful to state who these men are. AT: "two prophets who had lived long ago, Moses and Elijah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This implies that he was permitting them to tell people about what they had seen only after he rose from being dead. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he commanded them to tell no one ... until the Son of Man had risen

contextId.information: The scribes taught that Elijah would come back to earth before the Messiah came. AT: "that Elijah must come first before the Messiah comes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It may be helpful to state what people did to him. AT: "and our leaders treated him very badly, just as they wanted to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and they did whatever they wanted to him

contextId.information: It may be helpful to state why they were amazed. AT: "was amazed that Jesus had come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Though it was the boy's father who made a request of Jesus, Jesus responds to the whole crowd. This can be made clear. AT: "Jesus responded to the crowd" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
They were silent because they were ashamed to tell Jesus what they had been discussing. AT: "they were silent because they were ashamed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"sending away demons." This refers to casting demons out of people. AT: "driving demons out of people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Jesus' disciples were traveling with him. They were leaving Capernaum. AT: "Jesus and his disciples left Capernaum" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This means that Jesus would touch them with his hands and bless them. AT: "he might touch them with his hands and bless them" or "he might lay his hands on them and bless them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Jesus is speaking about himself. This can be stated clearly. AT: "I, the Son of Man," (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to rising from the dead. AT: "he will rise from being dead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers back to the previous verse about the Gentile rulers. This can be stated clearly. AT: "But do not be like them" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: But it shall not be this way among you

contextId.information: Jesus is called the Son of David because he is a descendant of King David. AT: "You who are the Messiah descended from King David" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This phrase is written this way to place emphasis on the man's faith. Jesus heals the man because he believes that Jesus can heal him. This can be made explicit. AT: "I am healing you because you believed in me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Jesus will send it back promptly when he is finished using it. AT: "will immediately send it back when he no longer needs it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: will immediately send it back here

contextId.information: It was a tradition to lay garments on the road in front of important people to honor them. This can be made explicit. AT: "Many people spread their garments on the road to honor him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Many people spread their garments on the road

contextId.information: "Blessed is the kingdom that is coming." This refers to Jesus coming and ruling as king. AT: "Blessed be the coming of your kingdom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This means that he did not find any figs. AT: "he found only leaves and no figs on the tree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
Jesus is driving these people out of the temple. This can be written clearly. AT: "began to drive the sellers and buyers out of the temple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: began to cast out the sellers and the buyers in the temple

contextId.information: It is understood that this will happen because God will provide what you ask for. This can be stated clearly. AT: "God will do it for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The religious leaders imply that they will suffer from the people if they give this answer. AT: "But if we say, 'From men,' that would not be good." or "But we do not want to say that it was from men." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

The author, Mark, explains why the religious leaders did not want to say that John's baptism was from men. This can be stated clearly. "They said this to each other because they were afraid of the people" or "They did not want to say that John's baptism was from men because they were afraid of the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: They were afraid of the people

contextId.information: This means that he carved a pit on the rock, which would be the bottom part of the winepress used for collecting the squeezed grape juice. AT: "carved a pit into rock for the winepress" or "he made a vat to collect the juice from the winepress" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: dug a pit for a winepress

contextId.information: This refers to the time of harvest. This can be made clear. AT: "When the time came to harvest the grapes" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This means that they did not give him any of the fruit. AT: "without any grapes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be written more clearly. AT: "they beat that one on the head, and they hurt him terribly" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: they wounded him in the head

contextId.information: This refers to servants that the owner sent. The phrase "in the same way" refers to them being mistreated. This can be written clearly. AT: "They also mistreated many other servants whom he sent" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: They treated many others in the same way

contextId.information: It is implied that this is the owner's son. AT: "his beloved son" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "others" refers to other vine growers who will care for the vineyard. AT: "he will give the vineyard to vine growers to care for it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: will give the vineyard to others

contextId.information: They were amazed at what Jesus had said. This can be made explicit. AT: "They marveled at him and at what he said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This phrase explains who the Sadducees were. This can be written more clearly. AT: "who say there is no resurrection from the dead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: who say there is no resurrection

contextId.information: This means that the man should marry his brother's wife, not only that he take her and sleep with her to produce children. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the man should take the brother's wife

contextId.information: This means the children will be considered the dead brother's descendants. This can be made explicit. AT: "have children for his brother who will be considered his descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It may be helpful to state what they are mistaken about. AT: "When you say that dead people do not rise again, you are quite mistaken" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The "stones" refer to the stones that the buildings were built with. AT: "the wonderful buildings and the wonderful stones that they are made of" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the wonderful stones and wonderful buildings

contextId.information: They have arrived at the Mount of Olives, and Jesus has sat down. Information can be made more explicit. AT: "After arriving at the Mount of Olives, which is opposite the temple, Jesus down. Then Peter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: As he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter

contextId.information: This refers to what Jesus had just said will happen to the stones of the temple. This can be made clear. AT: "these things happen to the buildings of the temple ... are about to happen to the temple buildings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: these things happen ... are about to happen

contextId.information: Jesus is warning his disciples not to be deceived by anyone about what will happen. Here "lead astray" is a metaphor for deceive. AT: "deceives you concerning what will happen" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

This refers to the end of the world. Missing information can be added. AT: "but it is not the end of the world yet." This can also be written in positive form.  AT: "the end of the world is still to come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: but the end is not yet

contextId.information: This means they will testify about Jesus. This can be made clear. AT: "and testify to them about me" or "and you will tell them about me" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Jesus is still speaking about things that must happen before the end comes. This can be made clear. AT: "But the gospel must first be proclaimed to all the nations before the end will come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: But the gospel must first be proclaimed to all the nations

contextId.information: This means to be faithful to God until the end of that person's life. This may be stated in active form.  AT: "God will save whoever is faithful to him, enduring these trials, to the end of his life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: whoever endures to the end, that person will be saved

contextId.information: This is not Jesus speaking. Matthew added this to get the readers' attention, so that they would listen to this warning. AT: "may everyone who is reading this pay attention to this warning" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Jesus told them these things to warn them. AT: "I have told you all these things ahead of time to warn you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I have told you all these things ahead of time

contextId.information: This refers to the days of tribulation. AT: "these things I have just described" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It can be stated clearly what "time" refers to here. AT: "when that time will come when all these events will happen" (UDB)  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
At the beginning of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, it was customary to sacrifice a lamb. AT: "when it was customary to sacrifice the Passover lamb" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: when they sacrificed the Passover lamb

contextId.information: They were to prepare the meal for Jesus and his disciples to eat. AT: "Prepare the meal for us there" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Make the preparations for us there

contextId.information: It may be helpful to state where they came to. AT: "he came with the twelve to the house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This means that he broke the bread into pieces for the people to eat. AT: "broke it into pieces" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The covenant is for the forgiveness of sins. This can be written more explicitly. AT: "This is my blood that confirms the covenant, the blood that is poured out so that many may receive the forgiveness of sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: This is my blood of the covenant, the blood that is poured out for many

contextId.information: This means that if God would allow it to happen. AT: "if God would allow it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here "this hour" refers to Jesus' time of suffering, both now in the garden and later. AT: "that he would not have to go through this time of suffering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here "the one" refers to the man that Judas was going to identify. AT: "he is the one you want" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

As Peter followed Jesus, he stopped at the high priest's courtyard. This can be written clearly. AT: "and he went as far as the courtyard of the high priest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: as far as the courtyard of the high priest

contextId.information: They covered his face with a cloth or blindfold, so he could not see. AT: "to cover his face with a blindfold" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The servant girls worked for the high priest. AT: "one of the servant girls who worked for the high priest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: one of the servant girls of the high priest

contextId.information: The people were identifying Peter as one of Jesus' disciples. This can be made more clear. AT: "one of Jesus' disciples" or "one of those who have been with that man they arrested" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to Pilate releasing a prisoner at feasts. This can be made clear. AT: "to release a prisoner to them as he had done in the past" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: to do for them as he had done in the past

contextId.information: They envied Jesus, probably because so many people were following him and becoming his disciples. AT: "the chief priests were envious of Jesus. This is why they" or "the chief priests were envious of Jesus' popularity among the people. This is why they" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: it was because of envy that the chief priests

contextId.information: It may be helpful to explain that myrrh is a pain-relieving medicine. AT: "wine mixed with a medicine called myrrh" or "wine mixed with a pain-relieving medicine called myrrh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be written more clearly. AT: "one on a cross on the right side of him and one on a cross on the left side of him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: one on the right of him and one on his left

contextId.information: The people refer to Jesus by what he earlier prophesied that he would do. AT: "You who said you would destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You who would destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days

contextId.information: The means to believe in Jesus. AT: "believe in him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It can be stated clearly that they misunderstood what Jesus said. AT: "When some of those standing there heard his words, they misunderstood and said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Some of those standing by heard his words and said

contextId.information: "gave it to Jesus." The man held up the staff so that Jesus could drink wine from the sponge. AT: "held it up to Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

If he did not bury Jesus that evening he would have to wait until the Sabbath was over because the law did not permit anyone to do any type of work on the Sabbath. This can be made explicit. AT: "asked for the body of Jesus so that he could bury him immediately while it was still the day of preparation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: asked for the body of Jesus
